entry.title: Andriy Kovalchuk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Major-General Andriy Kovalchuk (pictured), commander of the 2022 Ukrainian southern counteroffensive, met his wife, a fellow officer, when she chastised him for wearing an unpolished belt buckle?

entry.title: toasting forks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that extendable marshmallow toasting forks were cited as an example of how glamping has "ruined" camping?

entry.title: Silvia Hauer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Silvia Hauer, a singer of Rossini's Rosina and Bizet's Carmen at Staatstheater Wiesbaden, performed the mezzo-soprano solo of Verdi's Requiem in 2022?

entry.title: Parallax Graphics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mike Judge's three-month tenure at the video-card manufacturer Parallax Graphics was an inspiration for Office Space?

entry.title: R.I.P. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that it was rumored that "R.I.P." was initially intended for Rihanna, but it became a song for Rita Ora instead?

entry.title: Bruce Timm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bruce Timm created most of the character designs for Batman: The Animated Series?

entry.title: upheld West Virginia's largest punitive damages award in history (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1993, the U.S. Supreme Court upheld West Virginia's largest punitive damages award in history, awarding $10 million – 526 times larger than the compensatory damages?

entry.title: Mini mum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mini mum is miniscule, but it is not Mini scule?
